item.title: 5 Underrated Horror Movies You Need to Watch This Halloween
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hastings
item.description:
This Halloween, I’m skipping the blockbusters and diving into 5 underrated horror movies that totally deserve more hype. Creepy, clever, and criminally overlooked.

The post 5 Underrated Horror Movies You Need to Watch This Halloween appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Why underrated horror hits different

Every October, I get hit with the same rotation of horror classics—and don’t get me wrong, I love them. But sometimes, I want something unexpected. Something that makes me sit up, question everything, and wonder, “How have I never seen this before?”

That’s when I turn to the overlooked, the under-hyped, and the quietly creepy. These five horror movies might not show up in every Halloween roundup, but they’ve all earned a permanent spot in my spooky season lineup.

Looking for even more picks? Don’t miss TV critic Randy Harward’s weekly What To Watch guide for the freshest streaming recs.

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

1. The Invitation (2015)

I remember watching this one with a friend who kept saying, “Nothing’s happening!” until—well, let’s just say a lot happened. It’s a slow-burn dinner party thriller that turns your nerves into spaghetti. The whole thing had me side-eyeing every polite host for weeks.

Where to stream The Invitation

Watch Options

2. Lake Mungo (2008)

This one absolutely wrecked me. It’s set up like a documentary, but it builds a ghost story that feels way too real. I kept pausing and rewinding certain scenes because I swore I saw something move. It’s subtle, it’s sad, and it sticks with you.

Where to stream Lake Mungo

Watch Options

3. Hell House LLC (2015)

Okay, this one legit scared me. I thought I was over found-footage films, but Hell House LLC pulled me right back in. It’s about a haunted house crew setting up for Halloween—and spoiler alert: it goes very wrong. I made the mistake of watching it alone, and I was checking corners in my house all night.

Where to stream Hell House LLC

Watch Options

4. The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)

There’s something so claustrophobic about this one. It starts simple—a father and son doing a routine autopsy—but nothing about this body is routine. The deeper they dig, the weirder (and scarier) it gets. I was fully glued to the screen, whispering “nope, nope, nope” by the end.

Where to stream The Autopsy of Jane Doe

Watch Options

5. The Blackcoat’s Daughter (2015)

There’s something so claustrophobic about this one. It starts simple—a father and son doing a routine autopsy—but nothing about this body is routine. The deeper they dig, the weirder (and scarier) it gets. I was fully glued to the screen, whispering “nope, nope, nope” by the end.

Where to stream The Blackcoat’s Daughter

Watch Options

The post 5 Underrated Horror Movies You Need to Watch This Halloween appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: Chow Down on Laughs: How to Watch Every Bob’s Burgers Thanksgiving Episode
item.dc:creator: Bill Frost
item.description:
The Belcher family has been trying to cook up the perfect Thanksgiving for almost all seasons of Bob’s Burgers—they’ve even succeeded a couple of times. Watching Bob transform from a mild-mannered burger flipper into a maniacal turkey chef has become a fall TV tradition. 11 previous Bob's Burgers classics are available to stream on Hulu. Dig in!

The post Chow Down on Laughs: How to Watch Every <i>Bob’s Burgers</i> Thanksgiving Episode appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free on Hulu

Serve up some Bob’s Burgers with your turkey

The Belcher family has been trying to cook up the perfect Thanksgiving for almost every season of Bob’s Burgers—they’ve even succeeded a couple of times. Watching Bob transform from a mild-mannered burger flipper into a maniacal turkey chef has become a fall TV tradition.

While there hasn’t been a Thanksgiving episode in a few seasons (Bob needs a holiday off once in a while), 11 previous Bob’s Burgers Turkey Day classics are available to stream now on Hulu. Dig in!

Never miss a TV show or deal again

Sign up for our email newsletter for all the latest in entertainment, reviews, deals, and more.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

“An Indecent Thanksgiving Proposal” (Season 3, Episode 5)

The very first Bob’s Burgers Thanksgiving episode finds the Belchers pretending to be their landlord Mr. Fischoeder’s family for the holiday in exchange for free rent. Meanwhile, a bummed Bob trips on absinthe in the kitchen and bonds with “Lance” the turkey.

“Turkey in a Can” (Season 4, Episode 5)

Bob prepares a three-day salt-rub turkey for Thanksgiving dinner, but somehow the bird ends up in . . . the toilet? Then Bob’s Burgers becomes a crime procedural, with Bob and Louise investigating the case separately and finding wildly different results. You’ll never guess the culprit.

“Dawn of the Peck” (Season 5, Episode 4)

“It’s gonna be like the running of the bulls, but cute and safe!” That’s Linda’s observation of the Wonder Wharf’s Turk-tacular Turkey Town Festival & Turkey Trot 5K, which is quickly proven half-wrong. Angry turkeys, chickens, and geese organize and (hilariously) attack the Trotters.

“Gayle Makin’ Bob Sled” (Season 6, Episode 4)

A massive snowstorm thwarts Bob’s errand to pick up Linda’s sister Gayle for Thanksgiving, forcing the two (and Gayle’s cat, Mr. Business) to find their way back to the restaurant on foot and sled. Making matters worse, cooking the Thanksgiving turkey is now up Linda—nooo!

Order your Burgers on Hulu

Seasons 1–13 of Bob’s Burgers are available to stream on Hulu, which you can read about in our broiled-to-perfection Hulu Review.

“The Quirk-ducers” (Season 7, Episode 6)

Tina adapts her erotic fiction into a stage musical, The Quirky Turkey, for the school’s annual Thanksgiving play. It sounds like a terrible idea because Louise made it happen, believing it’ll be bad enough to get canceled and have school dismissed. Spoiler: no half-day for Louise.

“Thanks-Hoarding” (Season 8, Episode 5)

The Belchers agree to help Teddy clean up his apartment so he can host Thanksgiving dinner for his family. But once the family arrives at Teddy’s junk-piled pad, they realize that he’s a hoarder and doesn’t want to get rid of anything. Like any Teddy-centric episode, things get weird.

“I Bob Your Pardon” (Season 9, Episode 7)

The kids discover that a local turkey pardoned by the mayor will meet its demise regardless, kicking off a political scandal and a blackmail scheme just in time for Thanksgiving. “I Bob Your Pardon” is most notable for the return of Double Butt the Goat, which is self-explanatory.

“Now We’re Not Cooking with Gas” (Season 10, Episode 8)

After five years on a waiting list, Bob finally gets a rare, exotic turkey for Thanksgiving—but then a gas leak on Ocean Avenue forces him to cook it over a campfire in the alley. Bob slowly loses it and begins yelling about Independence Day (?) as the kids scramble for anything to keep the fire burning.

“Diarrhea of a Poopy Kid” (Season 11, Episode 7)

Gene contracts stomach flu on the ultimate eating day of the year, leaving him stuck in the bathroom for Thanksgiving. Meanwhile, Bob, Louise, and Tina try to cheer him up with wild stories based on Predator, Air Force One, and Armageddon. But mostly, it’s diarrhea jokes.

“Stuck in the Kitchen with You” (Season 12, Episode 8)

The Belchers volunteer to help out with Thanksgiving at The Elegant Doily, a local retirement home. But, when the pressure of cooking for an entire community gets to Bob, Louise steps in and makes things worse. Meanwhile, Gene, Tina, and Zeke throw an impromptu T-day parade.

“Putts-giving” (Season 13, Episode 8)

The Belchers decide to spend Thanksgiving playing mini golf, but things don’t go well for competitive Linda as Bob constantly does better than her. Oh, and the kids are causing plenty of chaos, too. It wouldn’t be Putts-giving without some heavy property damage.

Let’s start watching!

  • What Channel is FOX on?
  • How to Watch the Bob’s Burgers Movie

The post Chow Down on Laughs: How to Watch Every <i>Bob’s Burgers</i> Thanksgiving Episode appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: How to Watch Friends Thanksgiving Episodes
item.dc:creator: Bill Frost
item.description:
If you find yourself with five hours to kill this season, you can binge-watch all 10 Friends Thanksgiving over the holiday—or any time, because why relegate the pleasure of hanging with Chandler, Monica, Ross, Rachel, Joey, and Phoebe again to just one weekend? Cider’s mulling, turkey’s turking, yams are yamming, let’s go!

The post How to Watch <i>Friends</i> Thanksgiving Episodes appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Every Episode on Max

Could there be a sitcom more closely associated with Thanksgiving than Friends? Yes, other classic network comedies did the occasional Turkey Day episode, but Friends made it an annual rite for 10 seasons from 1994 to 2004 on NBC. To paraphrase the wisdom of Joey, Thanksgiving without Friends was like the 4th of July without apple pie—or Friday with no two pizzas.

If you find yourself with five hours to kill this season, you can binge-watch all 10 Friends Thanksgiving over the holiday—or any time, because why relegate the pleasure of hanging with Chandler, Monica, Ross, Rachel, Joey, and Phoebe again to just one weekend? Cider’s mulling, turkey’s turking, yams are yamming, let’s go!

Give thanks for fast internet this year

Does your internet slow down when your family is in town? Enter your zip code below to see faster internet providers in your neighborhood.

How to watch Friends Thanksgiving episodes

All 236 Friends episodes are available to stream on-demand through HBO Max, including 10 centered around Thanksgiving (which we’ll detail in a minute).

You could cross your fingers for a Friends Thanksgiving marathon to pop up on cable channels TBS or Nick at Nite. Or buy individual episodes through Apple TV, Amazon Prime Video, or Google Play. But HBO Max is the more convenient—and less pricey—way to go.

Friends Thanksgiving episodes list

“The One Where Underdog Gets Away” (Season 1, Episode 9)

Our first Thanksgiving with the gang—aw! Everyone’s big Turkey Day plans fall through at the last minute, leaving the six new pals with just each other and grilled-cheese sandwiches. Plus a giant escaped Underdog balloon from the Thanksgiving Day parade and Ugly Naked Guy.

“The One With the List” (Season 2, Episode 8)

“The List” refers to a catalog of pros and flaws that Ross makes comparing Rachel to his current girlfriend, which inadvertently falls into Rachel’s none-too-pleased hands. There’s no Thanksgiving dinner in this episode, but there is Monica’s faux-chocolate Mockolate.

“The One With the Football” (Season 3, Episode 9)

While watching Thanksgiving Day football on TV, the gang decides to go outside and play a game of their own. The scrimmage eventually turns into a heated battle between the men and women, with Phoebe continually exposing her breasts to distract the guys (clutch play, Phebes).

“The One With Chandler in a Box” (Season 4, Episode 8)

As punishment for kissing his girlfriend, Joey tells Chandler he has to stay locked in a box for six hours, which Chandler does not take seriously. Meanwhile, Monica’s thankless Thanksgiving dinner prep leaves her with an eyepatch and an awkward smooch with her ex’s son.

“The One With All the Thanksgivings” (Season 5, Episode 8)

This flashback Thanksgiving episode has two enduring Friends visuals: Monica as a self-consciously overweight teen, and Monica wearing a turkey on her head as a (disgusting) proclamation of love for Chandler. Also, Phoebe flashes back to 1862, because why not?

Make friends with HBO Max

Spoiler: We’ll inform you below that you’ll need an HBO Max subscription to properly stream all of the Friends Thanksgiving episodes. Find out how to save some bucks on the service in our HBO Max Deals guide.

“The One Where Ross Got High” (Season 6, Episode 9)

Monica and Ross’ parents come over for Thanksgiving, but they have a beef with Monica’s boyfriend Chandler, who they think is still a stoner from his college days (the weed actually belonged to Ross). Meanwhile, Rachel tries making dessert, the infamous Friends meat-and-fruit “trifle.”

“The One Where Chandler Doesn’t Like Dogs” (Season 7, Episode 8)

In this Thanksgiving episode, we learn that Ross doesn’t like ice cream, Chandler is deathly afraid of dogs, and Rachel can’t wait to sleep with her office assistant (HR wasn’t a thing in 2000, apparently). There’s also a game to name all 50 states in six minutes with no winners.

“The One With the Rumor” (Season 8, Episode 9)

Monica invites high school friend Will (Brad Pitt) to Thanksgiving with the gang, only to learn that he still hates then-snob Rachel for mocking him back in the day (the joke being that Pitt and Jennifer Aniston were married at the time of filming). Also, Joey eats a whole turkey by himself.

“The One With Rachel’s Other Sister” (Season 9, Episode 8)

Rachel’s estranged sister Amy (Christina Applegate) shows up unannounced on Thanksgiving Day, eventually starting a fight over who should get custody of Rachel’s baby Emma (whom she didn’t even know existed until today). She ends up with Rachel’s Ralph Lauren discount instead.

“The One With the Late Thanksgiving” (Season 10, Episode 8)

As usual, Monica is cajoled into making Thanksgiving dinner for the Friends, but then Rachel and Phoebe are held up by a baby beauty pageant with Emma, and Ross and Joey split for a New York Rangers hockey game. But all’s well by the end of their late (and last) Thanksgiving dinner.

Let’s start watching!

  • HBO Max Review
  • HBO Max Deals

The post How to Watch <i>Friends</i> Thanksgiving Episodes appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.title: How To Watch Football on Thanksgiving 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Interested in watching NFL and college football games this Thanksgiving? Here’s what you need to know about this year’s Thanksgiving football schedule.

The post How To Watch Football on Thanksgiving 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch free on Fubo

I contend that Thanksgiving is the top fall holiday for several reasons: You get good company, better eating, and a reason to sit down and watch football all weekend.

This year’s Thanksgiving football lineup is filled with excellent matchups that’ll take you from dinner preparation to Black Friday shopping. Whether you’re an NFL or college football fan, I have what you need to know about the Thanksgiving college football and NFL game slate. Keep reading.

Jump to:

  • NFL Thanksgiving games
  • College football Thanksgiving games
  • Watch Thanksgiving football for free

Level up your TV plan for Thanksgiving football

Are you interested in college football or NFL games on Thanksgiving? Enter your zip code below to see cable TV providers in your area.

NFL Thanksgiving games

I’m stoked for this year’s Thanksgiving NFL games because they feature a full slate of great matchups across the league.

The NFL Thanksgiving lineup opens with the Green Bay Packers and Detroit Lions. The midday matchup will feature the Kansas City Chiefs versus the Dallas Cowboys, while the Thanksgiving Day nightcap will be an AFC North clash between the Cincinnati Bengals and Baltimore Ravens.

If the NFL’s Thanksgiving game schedule wasn’t enough, Amazon has also gotten into the Thanksgiving NFL business. As part of Amazon’s Thursday Night Football deal, Prime Video will have a Black Friday NFC matchup between the Chicago Bears and Philadelphia Eagles.

Thanksgiving NFL games schedule

Day Game Time (ET) Channels
Thursday, Nov. 28 Green Bay Packers at Detroit Lions 1:00 p.m. FOX, Fox Deportes
Thursday, Nov. 28 Kansas City Chiefs at Dallas Cowboys 4:30 p.m. CBS
Thursday, Nov. 28 Cincinnati Bengals at Baltimore Ravens 8:20 p.m. NBC, Telemundo, UNIVERSO, Peacock
Friday, Nov. 29 Chicago Bears at Philadelphia Eagles 3:00 p.m. Amazon Prime Video

Data effective as of post date.

Pro tip: Want more football content? Check out our weekly NFL schedule and college football schedule guides for our top picks and football takes.

College football Thanksgiving games

Annual rivalries like the Egg Bowl, Nebraska vs. Iowa, and Georgia Tech vs. Georgia will anchor this year’s college football Thanksgiving Day lineup have me really excited. Black Friday features a full day of college football games, while Memphis vs. Navy will be the sole Thanksgiving Day college football game.

How to watch football on Thanksgiving for free

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase*)

View on Amazon
Read full Mohu Leaf review

*CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

The NFL Thanksgiving Day games are all shared between FOX, NBC, and CBS, so you have multiple ways to tune in on Thanksgiving Day. All three channels are included on cable and streaming TV plans, so you’re set if you already have a TV setup.

If you want to watch NFL Thanksgiving football for free, we recommend installing an over-the-air (OTA) antenna like the Mohu Leaf on your TV. OTA antennas pull from local broadcast feeds and let you watch major channels like FOX and NBC for free. Streaming TV services like Hulu + Live TV and Fubo have free trial periods if you need to figure out a streaming setup on Thanksgiving Day. Check out our streaming TV trials guide to learn about these free offers.

As for the NFL’s Black Friday game, it’ll be a Prime Video exclusive, but you won’t need an active Amazon Prime membership to watch the game. Amazon will broadcast the game for free, and you’ll just need an Amazon account to watch it. Visit our Amazon Prime Video review to find out more.

FOX, NBC, CBS, and ABC will get multiple college football Thanksgiving games, and you can watch them for free with an OTA antenna or standard TV plan. You can also watch Thanksgiving college football games with a streaming TV service, and many streaming providers like Fubo offer free trials.

How to watch football on Thanksgiving FAQ

What NFL teams play on Thanksgiving?

This year, the Green Bay Packers, Detroit Lions, Kansas City Chiefs, Dallas Cowboys, Cincinnati Bengals, and Baltimore Ravens will play on Thanksgiving.

What college football games are on Thanksgiving?

Navy at Memphis is the only college football game airing on Thanksgiving Day. Black Friday will feature 13 college football games throughout the day.

What time is the NFL Thanksgiving game?

The NFL’s Thanksgiving games start at 1:00 p.m. ET with Packers at Lions. Dallas vs. Kansas City is at 4:30 p.m. ET, and the schedule wraps up with Ravens vs. Bengals at 8:20 p.m. ET. Amazon Prime Video will also have Eagles vs. Bears on Black Friday, and kickoff is at 3:00 p.m. ET.

Can I watch football on Black Friday?

Yes, there will be more than a dozen football games on Black Friday in 2025. There is one NFL game that day, and 13 college football games.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com senior writer, Eric Chiu, analyzed this year’s Thanksgiving college football and NFL schedule to figure out this year’s top matchups. He also drew from our cord-cutter and streaming deal coverage to find the best college football and NFL watch solutions for your home.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the Toronto Raptors: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Here’s how to watch the Toronto Raptors live on U.S. and Canadian TV. Our guide has the complete 2025–2026 TV schedule, channel listings, and streaming info.

The post How To Watch the Toronto Raptors: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
To be honest, we haven’t heard too much from the Raptors since they won with Kawhi, but Raptors fans are ready to move back into contention. The good news for fans is that the team is entering a new era built on youth, development, and a dose of unpredictability.
The front office doubled down this offseason, adding length, speed, and shooting to support a roster still learning how to win together. Scottie Barnes is slowly emerging as a franchise cornerstone, RJ Barrett is embracing his hometown role, and the recent signing of Brandon Ingram should go a long way to pushing them into playoff contention again. The only way to go is up, right?

From home games at Scotiabank Arena to national broadcasts spotlighting Toronto’s rising talent, the 2025–2026 season promises plenty of must-watch nights for fans across the continent.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Raptors channels
  • Toronto Raptors TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Raptors TV plans
  • Watch the Raptors for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Raptors games?

In Canada, Raptors broadcasts are split evenly between TSN and Sportsnet, with each network airing 41 regular-season games. Both channels are widely available across Canada through cable and satellite providers, and games can also be streamed live via the TSN app, TSN.ca, Sportsnet+, and the Sportsnet app.

For fans outside Canada or those looking for more hoops, NBA League Pass is the perfect option (though blackouts apply locally and nationally). Not only that, but national Raptors games will appear on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock in the U.S. Just remember that you’ll also need ABC, ESPN, and NBC for broader league coverage.

Want radio coverage? Broadcasts air on TSN 1050 Toronto and Sportsnet 590 The Fan. Fans can also stream audio via TSN.ca, iHeartRadio Canada, and the Sportsnet app.

2025–2026 Toronto Raptors TV schedule

Sportsnet kicks off coverage with the season opener in Atlanta on October 22, while TSN handles the home opener against Milwaukee two nights later. Key matchups include visits from Luka Doncic and the Lakers, Cooper Flagg and the Mavericks, and two games against the defending champion Thunder. TSN also covers both Raptors–Knicks games at Madison Square Garden.

Review the full Raptors TV schedule below, and stay tuned for updates related to channels and game times as the season progresses.

Brooklyn Nets Sunday, April 12 6:00 p.m. Sportsnet

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Raptors games

To follow the Raptors this season, Canadian fans have a steady mix of national TV and streaming options. If you’re looking for flexibility, Sportsnet+ and TSN standalone streaming plans allow you to watch games without a cable package, and both platforms include pre- and post-game coverage tailored to Raptors fans. Fans who want to watch on their own schedule can stream on-demand replays on both services.

If you want to watch Raptors’ games and you live outside of Canada, NBA League Pass remains the best way to catch every game not picked up by national broadcasters, though blackout rules still apply for in-market viewers. Throw in Peacock and Amazon Prime Video for streaming exclusive games, and you’re good to go.

Standalone in-market TV packages for Raptors games

For Raptors fans in Canada who prefer streaming over cable, you don’t need a full live TV bundle to follow the team. Instead, you can subscribe directly to TSN and SportsNet+ in order to see every regular-season game.

TSN starts at $24.99 a month and $199.90 annually, while Sportsnet+ offers plans starting at $29.99 per month and $249.99 per year. These apps also include pre-game coverage, live stats, and post-game analysis and are available on major streaming devices, including iOS, Android, Apple TV, Roku, and smart TVs.

There’s no need to worry about regional channel confusion, either. Since TSN and Sportsnet are national networks in Canada, once you’re subscribed, you’ll get every game they carry without having to verify a zip code or switch feeds. For local fans who want reliable access without stacking subscriptions, these two services are the most direct path to full-season coverage.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Raptors for free

Catching Raptors games for free is a bit of a challenge, but you have a couple of strategies depending on where you live. For fans in Canada, your main move is to keep an eye out for free trial offers from the team’s broadcast partners, TSN and Sportsnet+. I’ve seen Sportsnet+ free trials pop up from time to time, but nothing from TSN.

The approach is similar for U.S. fans. You can use free trials of streaming services like Amazon Prime Video, Stream with DIRECTV, or Fubo to catch nationally televised NBA games. While the Raptors don’t have any regular-season games scheduled on ABC or NBC, a digital antenna is also a simple (if not janky) way to access select games on these networks.

Pro tip for Canadian fans: If you live near the U.S. border, a good antenna could help you pick up those ABC and NBC broadcasts. I recommend using Antennas Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator to see your local channel options.

How to watch the Toronto Raptors FAQ

Where can I watch most Raptors games in Canada?

The majority of Raptors games air nationally on TSN and Sportsnet, which split the broadcast schedule each season. Both networks are available through standalone streaming apps and most cable providers in Canada, ensuring fans across the country can tune in without regional restrictions.

Will the Raptors appear on U.S. national broadcasts?

Yes, though not as frequently as larger-market teams. Select Raptors games—especially those featuring marquee matchups or up-and-coming stars like Scottie Barnes—will appear on ESPN, ABC, and NBC. Fans in the U.S. can also stream select games on Peacock and Amazon Prime Video, depending on scheduling.

What’s new about the Raptors’ broadcast setup this year?

Not much is new for the 2025–2026 season, which keeps the TSN-Sportsnet split intact in Canada. That said, Canada Basketball’s expanded international media deal includes coverage of the NBA Playoffs, NBA Finals, and men’s and women’s NCAA March Madness through TSN.

How can I follow the Raptors if I’m traveling or living outside Canada?

NBA League Pass International is the best option for global fans. In most countries, it provides live and on-demand access to nearly every Raptors game. For radio listeners abroad, the TSN 1050 Toronto stream delivers live play-by-play coverage online and through the iHeartRadio app.

Why you should trust us

When you’re trying to figure out where the Raptors are playing, the last thing you need is guesswork. That’s why CableTV.com contributor Creshonda Smith pulled together this guide, piecing together every network schedule, media update, and broadcast change so you don’t have to.

Instead of tossing you a list of channels, we focused on what actually matters: how to watch the Raptors without missing a play. Clear, accurate, and built for fans who’d rather spend their time courtside, on the couch, or in the crowd than digging through fine print.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025–2026 Washington Wizards Season
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
A new era of Wizards basketball is underway with coach Brian Keefe and veteran star Khris Middleton. Here’s everything you need to watch D.C. turn the corner this season.

The post How To Watch the 2025–2026 Washington Wizards Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Wizards have been off the radar since the days of Bradley Beal and John Wall, but that doesn’t mean they can’t make a resurgence.

The team made a huge midseason move, trading Kyle Kuzma to bring in veteran sharpshooter Khris Middleton. He adds leadership, a championship pedigree, and a high playoff IQ to a young group. Middleton quickly opted in for the 2025–2026 season, signaling he’s committed to the D.C. experiment … at least for now.

The Wizards also added two other key pieces in CJ McCollum and Cam Whitmore. McCollum brings more veteran scoring, while Whitmore is an athletic wing with an elite first step and physicality on both ends of the floor.

With Brian Keefe newly installed as the full-time head coach, this is a franchise blending veteran savvy with rookie upside. The Wizards are making calculated moves that could lead to something special, and my guide has everything you need to watch every step of their journey.

Jump to:

  • Washington Wizards channels
  • Washington Wizards TV schedule
  • Best Washington Wizards TV plans
  • Watch Washington Wizards for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Washington Wizards games?

You can watch the Washington Wizards in the Mid-Atlantic region on Monumental Sports Network, which is available through traditional cable and streaming providers. Fans outside Washington’s TV market can still follow the team through NBA League Pass, with national and local blackout restrictions applying based on your location.

This season, nationally televised Wizards games will appear on Amazon Prime Video and Peacock. But you’ll also want ABC, ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV access to watch other high-profile NBA matchups.

Want radio coverage? The Washington Wizards offer full in-market radio coverage through Wizards Radio 24/7, available on the team’s app and website. Local fans can also tune in via the Wizards Radio Network, which includes stations like 980 AM WTEM and 1500 AM WFED.

2025–2026 Washington Wizards TV schedule

The Wizards are entering the new season with a lot to prove. After a few rebuilding years and roster reshuffles, Washington finally has a chance to test itself against a topsy-turvy Eastern Conference.

From early matchups against playoff hopefuls to divisional rivalries with the Knicks and Sixers, the Wizards will get plenty of opportunities to show whether their development is turning into real progress or if they still have a long way to go.

Check out the full 2025–2026 Wizards TV schedule below, as the team opens the regular season on the road against Milwaukee on October 22.

Best TV plans for watching the Washington Wizards

With the NBA’s new media rights deal, keeping up with the Wizards means finding a plan that covers both Monumental Sports Network for local coverage and the big national outlets for league-wide games.

My top recommendation for Wizards fans is now Stream with DIRECTV. It’s one of the few live TV streaming services that carries Monumental Sports Network for all your local games, and it also includes all the essential national channels like ESPN and NBC. The only big change this season is that you can no longer add NBA League Pass directly through the service. You’ll now need to get that as a separate subscription through NBA.com or Amazon Prime Video.

Speaking of Prime Video, you’ll still need a base subscription to that and Peacock Premium for each service’s exclusive games. Fortunately, you can use the TV schedule above to plan your subscriptions strategically.

Standalone in-market TV package for Wizards games

Beyond live TV packages, local fans can also subscribe to Monumental Sports Network directly with a Monumental+ streaming subscription. For $19.99 per month or $199.99 per year, you get all in-market Wizards broadcasts and access to behind-the-scenes content.

Monumental+ also covers the Washington Mystics (WNBA), Washington Capitals (NHL), and other regional teams, so D.C. sports fans can stay fully connected. The app is available on most major streaming devices and comes packed with useful features like live stats and multiview.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Washington Wizards for free

One of the easiest ways to watch Wizards games without paying is through free trial offers from streaming platforms like DIRECTV and YouTube TV. Each service carries national NBA networks, and most trials last up to a week, which is just enough to stream a few key matchups.

You can also tune into select NBA games on ABC and NBC using a digital antenna, an option that’s more valuable than ever with the league’s new TV deal. But an antenna is great for more than just basketball. Anyone living near local affiliate stations can get a ton of live sports coverage, ranging from NBA and WNBA games to NFL and NHL showdowns.

How to watch the Washington Wizards FAQ

Do I need cable to watch the Wizards on Monumental Sports Network?

No, you don’t need a cable subscription to watch Monumental Sports Network. You can stream the regional sports network through services like DIRECTV and Fubo. The channel is also available as a standalone subscription through Monumental+, which gives fans direct access to Wizards games without a traditional TV plan.

What’s the best streaming service for Washington Wizards games?

DIRECTV is one of the best TV providers for diehard Wizards fans. It includes Monumental Sports Network for local coverage, along with national channels like ESPN, NBC, and NBA TV. Its base plans also come with unlimited DVR, making it easy to rewatch every game.

Can I watch Monumental+ when outside the viewing area?

No, you can’t stream live Wizards games on Monumental+ if you’re outside the D.C.–Baltimore region because of NBA blackout rules. While the app may still provide access to other content like pre-game shows and analysis, the live games themselves are strictly geo-restricted. Instead, you’ll need NBA League Pass to catch out-of-market broadcasts.

Who’s the head coach for the Washington Wizards?

As of the 2025–2026 season, the Washington Wizards are coached by Brian Keefe, who was promoted to the permanent role in 2024 after serving as interim head coach. Keefe is known for his defensive schemes and strong background in player development, which the Wizards are leaning on as they continue their rebuild.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, is a dedicated sports writer who spent hours combing through all the TV details related to watching Washington Wizards games. She reviewed the broadcast schedules, blackout policies, team moves, and streaming possibilities to create a comprehensive viewing guide that covers everything from A to Z.

As a whole, our editorial team is committed to making sure fans know exactly where and how to watch the Wizards get busy this year, whether it’s a local Monumental Sports Network game or a primetime national broadcast.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the Utah Jazz: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Ready to watch Utah Jazz basketball? Don’t miss a single moment of the 2025–2026 season with our guide, covering the full TV schedule, channels, and streaming.

The post How To Watch the Utah Jazz: 2025–2026 Season TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Utah Jazz looked good when Donovan Mitchell was there, but it seemed like everything fell apart after his departure. They’ve got some really talented pieces in Lauri Markkanen and Keyonte George, and under head coach Will Hardy, Utah’s young roster showed flashes of something real– defensive grit, balanced scoring, and a chemistry that finally seemed to click.
This year, they’ve added some solid support in Kevin Love, Kyle Anderson, Jusuf Nurkić, and Georges Niang. Now, it’s about trying to put it all together and claw their way back into playoff contention. With Walker Kessler anchoring the paint and Markkanen continuing to play at an All-Star level, this team looks ready to get busy in the West.

Keep reading to find out where, when, and how to watch the Jazz throughout the 2025–2026 season.

Jump to:

  • Utah Jazz channels
  • Utah Jazz TV schedule
  • Best Utah Jazz TV plans
  • Watch the Jazz for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Utah Jazz games?

Most Utah Jazz games air locally for free (once again) on the team’s traditional pre-RSN home KJZZ 14, with every matchup also available through the team’s official streaming platform, Jazz+. This service gives fans in Utah and surrounding areas access to live broadcasts, pregame shows, and replays without needing a cable subscription.

Take note: Jazz fans without an over-the-air broadcast option in parts of Idaho and Wyoming can stream virtually every game through an exclusive KJZZ feed on Fubo.

For fans outside the region, NBA League Pass remains the best way to catch every Jazz game throughout the 2025–2026 season, though blackout rules still apply to nationally televised matchups.

National coverage for Utah has expanded this year, with more games airing on ESPN and ABC. NBC has also picked up select Jazz matchups as part of its new Sunday night basketball lineup. On the streaming front, Amazon Prime Video and Peacock will both carry exclusive NBA games throughout the season.

Want radio coverage? The Utah Jazz broadcast all games on the Utah Jazz Radio Network, which includes KZNS 1280 AM and 97.5 FM The Zone in Salt Lake City.

2025–2026 Utah Jazz TV schedule

The 2025–2026 season is hopefully a turning point for the Jazz, who have embraced having a young and steadily climbing team after Jordan Clarkson and Collin Sexton’s departure. Rising guard Keyonte George enters his third season and is expected to be more assertive, while rookies Ace Bailey (5th pick) and Walter Clayton Jr. (18th pick) join a team that also includes seasoned stalwarts Lauri “The Finnisher” Markkanen and Walker Kessler.

With the roster trending younger, the Jazz are aiming to compete rather than slide into Western Conference irrelevance. Check the TV schedule below for all tip‐offs and channel details as the season unfolds.

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the Utah Jazz games

To follow the Utah Jazz this season, there are a few options at your disposal, but DIRECTV STREAM remains the most complete choice. It’s one of the few live TV services that carries KJZZ 14 (the Jazz’s local broadcast partner), which airs the majority of regional games. It also includes national channels like ESPN, ABC, NBC, and NBA TV, giving you all the primetime matchups.

I like DIRECTV STREAM for its sports-friendly interface because it lets you pick your favorite teams, record every Jazz broadcast automatically, and watch on virtually any device. And, with unlimited DVR storage included, you won’t miss a single highlight.

For full coverage, you’ll still need separate subscriptions to Amazon Prime Video and Peacock, which stream exclusive NBA games throughout the season. And for fans outside Utah’s broadcast region, NBA League Pass allows you to watch out-of-market Jazz games, though blackout restrictions still apply.

Standalone in-market TV package for Jazz games

If you’re a Utah Jazz fan who wants to skip the bulky live TV bundles, go with the KJZZ 14 app and the Jazz+ streaming service. For $19.99 per month or $125.50 per year, Jazz+ gives in-market fans access to every locally televised game, along with pregame and postgame shows, classic replays, and exclusive team content.

Take note: You can also subscribe to SEG+ for $174.99 and get every Utah Mammoth local broadcast in addition to Jazz coverage.

Jazz+ runs through the NBA app or the Utah Jazz team app and works across all major devices, including Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, Android, and iOS. It’s a simple, affordable way to follow the Jazz without cable–whether you’re watching from Salt Lake City or anywhere in Utah’s local broadcast region.

Subscribers can also access bonus content like interviews with head coach Will Hardy, behind-the-scenes features, and player spotlights on stars such as Lauri Markkanen and Walker Kessler. For local fans, Jazz+ is the easiest, most direct way to stay connected all season.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Utah Jazz for free

Watching Jazz basketball doesn’t have to drain your wallet. You can catch several games for free by taking advantage of streaming free trials from platforms like Fubo, DIRECTV, and YouTube TV. These trials typically last 5–7 days and include access to national channels such as ABC, ESPN, and NBC—perfect for tuning in to marquee Jazz matchups.

Another no-cost option is a digital antenna, which lets in-market fans in Utah and parts of Idaho, Nevada, and Wyoming pick up locally aired Jazz games on KJZZ 14. You’ll also get free access to national broadcasts that air on ABC and NBC. And for fans on the go, the NBA app sometimes features complimentary radio coverage or select live streams, no matter where you are.

How to watch the Utah Jazz FAQ

What is Jazz+ and who can use it?

Jazz+ is the Utah Jazz’s direct-to-consumer streaming platform that lets in-market fans watch all locally televised games live without cable. It’s available through the NBA app and most major streaming devices, including Roku, Apple TV, and Amazon Fire TV.

Can I watch Jazz games over the air without a subscription?

Yes, local fans in Utah can tune in to KJZZ-TV Channel 14 using a digital antenna. This free, over-the-air option broadcasts select Jazz games in HD for viewers across the Salt Lake City market.

What options are there for fans outside the Utah region?

If you live outside the Jazz’s broadcast zone, NBA League Pass is your best bet to catch non-national Jazz games. Just note that blackout restrictions apply to in-market and nationally televised matchups, so check the NBA blackout rules before subscribing.

What is the cheapest way to watch the Utah Jazz?

For local fans, the most cost-effective way to watch most Jazz games is on KJZZ-TV using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna for a one-time purchase of about $50. Unfortunately, for rabid Jazz fans outside of Utah and the surrounding areas, catching most games requires combining a few services. You’ll need a local cable package and a Peacock Premium plan, along with an NBA League Pass subscription for complete coverage.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, spent hours going through Utah Jazz broadcast schedules, blackout policies, roster updates, and platform availability to bring fans a clear viewing roadmap for the 2025–2026 season.

She verified local listings on KJZZ-TV, tested streaming options like Jazz+, and confirmed national coverage details from ESPN, ABC, and NBC.

Our editorial team’s mission is to make sure Jazz fans never miss a Walker Kessler block, a Lauri Markkanen jumper, or any clutch play—no matter where they’re watching from.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

Peacock is a must-have streaming service for soccer fans in the U.S. to watch the English Premier League (EPL). Just under half of the league’s 380 games stream exclusively on Peacock, with NBC match simulcasts also available on the service. But you’ll need USA Network to catch other matches not streaming on Peacock.

To get Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans—starting at $10.99 a month. Not only will you receive around 175 live Premier League games per season, but you’ll also have thousands of movies and TV shows at your fingertips. As for USA Network, you’ll need a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming plan to pick up the channel.

Keep reading to learn more about how to watch the Premier League in the U.S. We update this guide regularly with the league’s U.S. TV schedule and channel listings to help you tune in.

Jump to:

  • Premier League channels
  • Premier League TV schedule
  • Best Premier League TV plans
  • Watch the Premier League for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels show Premier League games?

Premier League fans in the U.S. can watch every match across NBC, Peacock, and USA Network. If you prefer Spanish-language commentary, Telemundo, UNIVERSO, and Peacock carry select games en Español.

Some matches may appear on other NBCUniversal networks, such as CNBC, Golf Channel, and Syfy, especially on Championship Sunday. But Peacock often simultaneously streams those games and all matches that air on NBC.

Pro tip: Fans of England women’s soccer can catch many Women’s Super League and Women’s Championship matches on the Barclays WSL and Barclays WC YouTube channels. Some WSL games also stream on ESPN+.

Premier League TV schedule

The 2025–2026 Premier League season began on August 15, 2025, and wrap up with Championship Sunday on May 24, 2026. Keep in mind that all match times are subject to change due to cup competitions and weather, which is why we update this section nearly every week of the season.

Below, you’ll find a list of the upcoming matchday fixtures with U.S. kickoff times and channel listings. You can also visit the official Premier League Matches webpage to see the entire calendar.

Match Day Time (ET) Channels
Matchweek 8

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the Premier League

Peacock is an essential part of watching the Premier League in the U.S. Yet, to enjoy every game this season, you must supplement Peacock with a TV provider that carries USA Network.

Fortunately, Peacock is an inexpensive service. Its premium plans start at $10.99/mo., and grant you access to nearly half of this season’s Premier League games. On top of that, Peacock includes thousands of movies and TV shows alongside additional live sports. We’re talking NFL, Premiership Rugby, and WWE events. You even get complete Spanish-language access to the FIFA World Cup and FIFA Women’s World Cup each time those tournaments come around.

The cheapest way to get USA Network is through Sling TV. The live TV streaming service offers the channel in its Sling Blue plan for $45.99/mo. But if you have more room in your budget, Hulu + Live TV also has NBC Sports channels and includes ESPN+ at no extra cost—giving you live FA Cup, La Liga, and Bundesliga games. Unfortunately, you’ll also need Paramount+ in your streaming roster if you want robust EFL Championship and League One coverage.

What TV providers carry Premier League games?

Most cable, satellite, and live TV streaming services carry Premier League games via NBC, CNBC, and USA Network. But as shown in our table below, some providers don’t have any NBCUniversal channels.

Find the best provider for watching soccer

Provider coverage varies by location, so enter your zip code below to see top-ranked options in your area.

Premier League content on Peacock

Peacock has a wealth of Premier League content. It streams around 175 live games and occasionally offers multiview coverage. With Peacock, you can also watch on-demand replays of all 380 league matchups each season. Replays of games that didn’t originally air live on Peacock become available 24 hours after the match ends and are available to stream for 30 days.

Outside of actual games, Peacock is also home to Premier League studio shows, highlights, and docuseries. There’s even a 24/7 live channel called Premier League TV that really comes in handy on transfer deadline days.

What’s great about Premier League TV is that it airs a mixture of U.S.- and U.K.-produced content. This means you’ll get the best of both worlds with NBC Sports and Sky Sports programming. We particularly enjoy The Kelly & Wrighty Show, which features presenter Kelly Cates and Arsenal legend Ian Wright.

Here’s a list of Premier League programs featured on Peacock:

  • The 2 Robbies
  • The Analysis Show
  • The Big Interview
  • The Catch Up Show
  • Fantasy Premier League
  • Goal Rush
  • Headline Makers
  • The Kelly & Wrighty Show
  • The Lowe Down
  • The Men in Blazers Show
  • Netbusters
  • PL Stories
  • Premier League 100
  • Premier League Fanzone
  • Premier League Match Pack
  • Premier League Today
  • The Weekend Preview
  • The Weekend Review

How to watch the Premier League for free

Get Free Local Channels

†CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can watch Premier League games free in the U.S. using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to pick up your local NBC or Telemundo station. Unfortunately, neither channel is available in every corner of the country. But you can use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to verify if they’re within range.

There isn’t a free way to access Premier League games on Peacock. However, you can sign up for a live TV streaming trial to watch games on NBC and USA Network without paying. Fubo offers a seven-day free trial and provides access to both channels.

How to watch the Premier League FAQ

Is the Premier League free on Peacock?

No, the Premier League is not free on Peacock. To watch live Premier League matches on Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans (starting at $10.99 a month).

Does Peacock Premium have all Premier League games?

No, Peacock Premium doesn’t have all Premier League games available to stream live—but it does have every game available to stream on demand. Games that don’t appear live on Peacock will air on USA Network or CNBC for English-language coverage and UNIVERSO for Spanish-language coverage. These games will become available as full match replays on Peacock 24 hours after they end.

Do Peacock ads interrupt Premier League games?

No, ads don’t interrupt ongoing Premier League matches. You’ll see commercials before and after each half, regardless of whether you subscribe to the ad-based Peacock Premium ($10.99 a month) or the ad-free Peacock Premium Plus ($16.99 a month).

What app has Premier League games?

You can catch live Premier League games on the Peacock app and the NBC Sports app. You’ll need a Peacock Premium subscription to watch Premier League games on the Peacock app, while the NBC Sports app requires you to log in with your TV provider’s credentials.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been an avid Premier League fan for over a decade. He deeply understands the main frustration for U.S. fans: the weekly channel shuffle between NBC, USA Network, and Peacock.

To create this guide, Taylor combined his hands-on experience as a Peacock subscriber with research into NBC Sports’ U.S. broadcast deal (which runs through the 2027–2028 season). He also compared Peacock’s value and Premier League game count with traditional TV options.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.
